Text.text: Excellent 360 camera for the price, beware of the red spot (flare) that occurs in outdoor pictures taken in sunny days.
I called Ricoh's technical support and they advised me to either return the camera to Amazon and get an exchange or send it for repair.
I did get an exchange only to find out that it is a common problem with wide angle cameras.
Ricoh's support should have been aware of the issue!
I give the camera 5 stars anyway for its low price, simplicity and picture quality.

Review.title: Just as I switched to 360 mode everything went fuzzy ...

Text.text: Just as I switched to 360 mode everything went fuzzy.
Posters on the wall could not be read as well as large text on items on my desk.
I would have expected at least picture quality images but that was no the case.
I did a bit of research and found quite a few links to this camera's fuzzy images, not something I saw when I was reviewing before purchase.

Review.author: R. Marlowe
Review.title: Love this — wish more photo software knew how to handle it

Text.text: This produces great 360 photos with a single touch.
No more taking the phone and spinning in a slow circle in a crowded room, taking 15 seconds and being obnoxious about it.
The photos look pretty darn good for the time it takes.
I wish more display software understood how to stitch it back into a scrollable 360 photo with complete continuity, but that’s a minor complaint.
A must-have for realtors, lawyers, and those who want to remember exactly what the entire scene wa slime at a specific point in time.
It takes good 360 photos.
I would spend some time researching what all the settings mean because auto function for image capturing does not return the best photos.
A really good 360 camera, and if you are a software developer the APIs are rock solid.
Love it.
Everything seems to be fine with it.
It works like charm.
And quality is good.
If you wish super sharp clear quality get the 4k one.
But take advantage if you can cuz no one seems to be picking up this technology and how amazing it is.
You can upload your pics and vids to facebook and youtube.
Pictures upload directly from your phone, videos need to have a 'meta tag' added (google for '360 video meta tag for facebook' and itll show up.

Review.author: Unique Individual
Review.title: Amazing Image Resolution and Dynamic Range

Text.text: Amazing image quality.
I did not expect image quality this good.
You can clearly see faces up to a few feet away (they'll be tiny, but you can zoom).

Plus the sensor must have some dynamic lighting algorithm because I'm amazed at how it takes in the shadows outside without blowing out the sky too much, regardless of my hand's subtle shakiness, I've never seen motion blur.
I've been photographing with the exposure bias at one whole stop brighter and everything looks great at that setting.
Otherwise, presumably everything would be too dark.
But with that one adjustment, I've been amazed by the image.
The body is hefty, and I dropped it on my third photograph, and all that happened was the facade separated a little (like when you pop the case/back off a phone body).
I snapped it back in and although a little loose, it works A-OK. Only gripe is that sharing the files aren't as easy as I expected.
I have to connect to it with my camera through wifi in order to see the image live, and when I take a photo it takes a moment to transfer the image to the phone.
To see it in 3-D it has to be in the app (on my phone), or I can post it to my facebook which has a 3D viewer.
I found the files in my phone and they appear like the flat map projection of earth from NASA (with the top rows really stretched).
The secondary Ricoh app that I thought would allow me to render out OTHER flat projections doesn't do any of the projections I expected it to do... That's my only issue.
Otherwise a new way to visualize and more-or-less document my travels.
Also neat to take a photo when eating out with friends and everyone is frame!

Review.author: Steven Andrew Gibson
Review.title: Know you need to shell more $ out after you buy the cam

Text.text: Awesome tech but why does one have to download an app to run all the available functions?
Also, why should we have to purchase more in apps to edit the videos and stills.
That should be free due to the cost of the product.

Review.author: Trigger Happy
Review.title: Save your money for something better

Text.text: Bought this because of the relatively low price and as an introduction to 360 camera.
Didn’t expect much and didn’t get much.
Video quality is horrendous if any type of movement is involved since there is no stabilization.
Video in generally is terrible because of the low resolution.
Pictures are ok but your average phone will take better pictures.
Don’t be fooled by when it states HD video or 14mp photos.
What you have to consider is that when you record or take photos in 360, you have to spread those pixels across a much greater range.
A 14mp photo looks like a 3mp photo on a non 360 camera but of course with more in the frame.
Same with video.
Because the area of coverage is so great, you can barely make out what you are looking at.
The camera seems well built and helped me understand in what situations a 360 camera could be useful.
Fun for awhile until the novelty runs out.
Have used this with IPhone and the images are stunning.
Using specifically for Google Streetview photos and so far it's working perfectly.

Review.author: Amazon Customer
Review.title: but the video were very very bad even with all the best conditions

Text.text: The still images were all ok, but the video were very very bad even with all the best conditions.
To say that the Theta S records 'Full HD' video is misleading at best and false advertising at worst.
The video files that camera records are 1920x1080 pixels, but most of those pixels are black (see attached frame grabs).

The actual recorded video file is two circles within a 1920x960 area, not even using it to the maximum, but each only 890 pixels in diameter (Full HD 1920x1080 video is 2,073,600 pixels or about 2.1 Megapixels, the combined resolution of the two recorded circles is 622,113 pixels or 0.6 Megapixels which is less than 1/3 the resolution of 'Full HD').

Once you run that file through the theta software to de-squeeze it the output is 1920x960 pixels (see photo with orange denoting Full HD frame size), but now at a significantly reduced bitrate (from the original 16Mb/s down to 6.6Mb/s) along with an associated reduction in quality with increased macro blocks, moire and other ugly artifacts.
Love it!
Worked great right out of the box; simple, fun and easy to use for both work and play.

Review.title: Simple to use. Arrived on time. The iPad ...

Text.text: Simple to use.

The iPad app is very basic and sometimes a little bit glitchy but it serves its purpose.
I expected the quality of the pictures and videos to be better, based on the specs.
In addition, the software that supports this camera NEEDS A MAJOR UPDATE.

It is terribly slow, you cannot preview the pictures or videos while they are stored in the camera (you always have to transfer them in order to see them), and the theta360 stuff in the apps is annoying.
The PC/Mac viewer is useless.
You have to constantly drag and drop each file in order to see the file.
This can be changed to like display a gallery of files within a specific directory... Another bad thing is the WiFi transfer speed.
It took me exactly 23 minutes to transfer a 586mb video from the camera to an iOS device; HORRIBLE!!!

I simply cannot use the camera on a full day trip to take several videos and pictures because with 14 videos of 5 mins each, I will not have enough space for more and I would have to spend HOURS to empty the camera before I can use it... What I like is the layout of the device, it feels solid on your hand, and it is not bulky as many of the 360 cameras out there.
I may return it because it does not execute as promised or expected.

I plugged it in overnight to charge and the fully charged indicator never clicked on.

The one time I wanted to use it, I could not, so I am not very happy about that especially on such an expensive camera.

Review.author: Marc
Review.title: The camera works great and takes good quality photos for the price

Text.text: Purchased the Theta S on July 6th.......
Dropped it on August 2nd.
The camera works great and takes good quality photos for the price.
But, there is a design/quality issue that Ricoh should address.
The lenses are easily scuffed.
Worse, if you drop it (and, sadly, didn't purchase the product protection plan) the lens cracks easily.
I had the padded slip case on mine, which provides zero impact protection, in my shirt pocket.
It fell out and landed on one of the lenses and left a cute little impact star on the lens.
You would expect lense replacement to be relatively simple and inexpensive.
If you crack your lens it's $200+ to send it in to the one and only repair center in the whole United States to get it fixed.
At $200+ I can purchase a couple 50mm camera lenses for my son's Nikon DSLR with change left over.
My only disappointment with an otherwise superb little camera.

I wish it was more stable on its own (not on a tripod).
I've already dinged one of the lenses because wind blew the camera over.
Luckily, the crack is near the bottom of the lens and isn't very noticeable.
In hindsight, I would never use this thing outdoors without a secure tripod.
That's unfortunate since the camera crops itself out of the picture, outdoor shots without a tripod are the best ones.
That's why the four stars instead of five.
Just a little more stable, equality in the Apple vs Android apps, and it would have the extra star.

Review.author: eclipse1960
Review.title: Ricoh managed to hang on to the brilliant optical and industrial design that allow it to disappear ...

Text.text: The Theta S is an improvement over the first-generation Theta in just about every direction.
With four times the resolution, vastly improved color sensitivity, a wider lens aperture, and a reduced price, it overcomes all of the shortcomings of the original as a still camera.
Meanwhile, Ricoh managed to hang on to the brilliant optical and industrial design that allow it to disappear from its own pictures with practically no stitching error.

The advances in the Theta S put it into a strong position in the spherical photo market ... but with everyone and their cousin jumping into that market over the coming months, Ricoh is going to be hard put to it to hang on.
Fun for a geek.

Review.author: MQ
Review.title: Good product for its price point.

Text.text: It's a good tool for anyone getting into 360 video/images, it is simple to produce 360 images/videos because their software does the automatic stitching of the two cameras.
For this price point, you are not going to get or should expect clear images or video, like what you would get from a 6 camera GoPro rig.
Unfortunately their software is biased towards compression speed vs clarity so videos tend to be on the soft side even though the original footage on the camera is relatively sharp.
It is understandable since the videos would be quite large if they did not compress it so much.
I look forward when they will produce another camera with higher resolution and maybe an external storage interface.

The current 8GB gives you about 45 minutes of video recording which is more than enough since the battery dies before that, but it would be great to not have to constantly remove data from the camera to free up storage.

They are more geared towards mounting it on your bike or snowboard to record video.
This thing fits in your pocket nicely and you can take it out n take pics and post them to social media easily.
Im very happy with it.

Review.author: IMFRML
Review.title: This 360 Camera Rocks! Such a great user experience.

Text.text: This camera rocks, I've used it so much for checking out event spaces and using outdoors.
The quality and experience is excellent.
I love how you don't need to use a phone to remotely shoot photos with it, but you can if you want.
It's so inconspicuous and easy to use.
So so excited for the 4K version!
I will get as soon as they release!

Review.author: McEntyre
Review.title: Taking 360 pics is fun but I can't really compare the quality of this ...

Text.text: Used the camera a few times after I first purchased it and it worked okay.
Taking 360 pics is fun but I can't really compare the quality of this camera to others as it's the only one I've used.
I got the camera out this week and I can't get the iPhone app to connect to the camera.
The phone is connecting but the app can't see the camera.
From searching around, this seems to be a common issue.
I haven't seen any responses from tech support other than basic 'turn it off and turn it back on' quality suggestions.
It seems to be a very common problem with no resolution that I've been able to find.
It's also not a new issue so support has had plenty of time to address the issue.
The camera is too expensive to be left virtually useless by an app connection issue.
I'd certainly send it back if I weren't past the return date.
Great for photos, mediocre to poor for video.
Good intro in the 360 filming world.
This one is fun for running around, no fuss, easy to use, auto stitches in camera, and loads super easy.
These folks have their camera aps down, they just need to up the resolution of the two cameras and add a gyro stabilization.
I love my camera!
The Ricoh Theta S is so easy to use, but can be controlled more masterfully if you know what you're doing.
Pretty nasty technology but pics arenot clear enough.

Review.author: Donna Powell
Review.title: ... this for work and so far it has been great.

Text.text: My husband had to have this for work and so far it has been great.
This is amazing product!!
I've got new excitement toy, this is not only capture the world but even making new friend at every corner of the world!
It's nice, but doesn't always focus properly.
Still worth having!
Amazing camera.
I took it to a wedding and took some priceless photos.

Review.author: A. Felix
Review.title: Great for the price and compact size

Text.text: The product itself is great for what it is.
It's compact and easy to use.
The issue is the horrible video quality once uploaded YouTube or Facebook.
Photos turn out great.
Easy to use but not simple to transfer or edit pics for common users.
nice images.
Once you get the hang of all the features this camera offers, and how to work with 360 photos and videos, it is Awesome!
Not for 12 o'clock flashers.
; ) Takes excellent night pictures too.
Small, and powerful.
And it Works great with the Samsung S7 and Galaxy Gear.
I love it
For our current level of technology this is simply amazing.
The quality is like an old iPhone camera... but it's in 360, with minimal stitching artifacts.
Sure it's not a $3,000 camera quality...
I got it for still images, haven't really got into the video aspect.
I've heard the Samsung 360 is better at video and worse at images.
You can see some of my uploads from the Theta here: [...]
For a point and shoot 360 camera this is it.
The hardware and the camera itself is sturdy and feels great in your hands.
After unboxing I was able to take a few photos around the yard and make a quick video, post to facebook, etc....
I started having problems the next day.
The battery didn't seem to charge, after emptying the camera of all photos it said it was full, and a constant red light and beeping.
Customer support was a joke.
I got told to 'turn it on and off'.
The customer support didn't even have a camera to reference on their end.
A quick look online I found that more and more people were having this problem.

Review.author: Amazon Customer
Review.title: Let me start off my saying that I love this camera for what it delivers (when it delivers)

Text.text: Let me start off my saying that I love this camera for what it delivers (when it delivers).
The images are great quality and the app gives me complete control over exposure.

I find that I would like to use the timelapse the most often, but unfortunately, the connection between the camera and my iphone 6 is so unreliable that I find myself writhing in frustration just trying to use the camera for what I want to.
The connection never works, and I find myself reading the same links online with useless troubleshooting info like 'reset the device.'
Furthermore there's nothing you can do about it, except hope and pray that it will for some miracle connect.
And based on other comments online, don't expect customer service to help you with any of it.
If I had any better options for a 360 camera in the same price range and offering the same features, I would definitely go for it instead.
A fantastic little camera

Review.author: jtabeto
Review.title: mount it anywhere..mount it with modeling clay

Text.text: superb images..sharing is a breeze.
Tips: spherical images can be downloaded to a computer for further editing and can be save back as jpeg an facebook woould still upload it as 360 photo..also use modeling clay to mount it anywhere
Video quality is sub par, at least when streaming live.
The biggest issue has to do with tripods.
You can't connect the camera's cables while its mounted on any tripod.
But wait, Ricoh has the answer.
You can order an adapter from them that raises the camera and allows the cable connection.
Another $20 to waste on something that should be included for free.
Oh, and the shipping is another $12 for the adapter.
I think not.
This camera is going back.
Amazing product that is innovative and easy-to-use.
Provides tons of fun and memories.
It works best in conjunction with a monopod.
I really wanted more from this camera.
Its fun and simple to use the basic modes.
The companion app for Android phones is quirky and hard to navigate.
The image quality is pretty good and its great that you can view them in VR headsets like Google Cardboard.
Its strange that you cannot do that with video yet it offers some odd VR mode which isn't quite the same and doesn't work with Cardboard.
All around a fun and almost affordable way to break into 360 spherical photography at a consumer level.

Review.author: bake978
Review.title: Poor Image Quality for Photospheres on Google Maps

Text.text: I was hoping this would be a 5 star purchase for me but it's just.
The design and functionality is perfect but the spherical image quality is not good.
I used to shoot photospheres for google maps on my iphone.
The laborsome and funny looking part was spinning in circles at all angles to capture about 20 images.
I thought this camera would be a great solution.
It works well with the app but the images are noticeable lower quality.
I am not happy with that at all.
I shot about 150 photospheres last week and was shocked when I saw how much distortion there is.
Here are examples.
You can totally tell which were taken with the iphone vs the camera.
Good clear pictures, great color.
Unique 360 view for taking pictures that would benefit from that capability - think outdoor food markets, public squares in old Europe, pretty valleys surrounded by high peaks, a pretty garden etc.
The challenge is excluding you from the picture.
Only works with the app, but it is fun.
I'm not often blown away by new tech gadgets, bit this little device is something special.
Awesome quality, features, and ease of use.

Review.author: Mariano Carrizo
Review.title: The best choice in 360 camera, you'll love it!

Text.text: This is definitely one of the best purchases I've made in the last times.
I was completely sure I wanted to have the Ricoh Theta after compare the few available 360 cameras available today.
This is the perfect combination of accessible price and features, and of course, the best quality you can get for that lower price.
Great product i love it so much
i love this camera.
i am a tech addict.
almost all new tech products i will buy and use it, then resale it after sometimes.
but this camera i Don't sell.
this is one of the best gadget for me.

Review.author: DianaAK
Review.title: I don't know if It's because I have a Mac but I was a little disappointed.

Text.text: I was so excited to use this product, I've recorded multiple little trips but haven't been able to successfully upload a video longer than 10 seconds on social media to share....
I don't know if It's because I have a Mac but I was a little disappointed.

Review.author: atiwary
Review.title: Picture quality is not as good as they advertise + it takes a while to ...

Text.text: Picture quality is not as good as they advertise + it takes a while to download pictures to phone.
Other than that it is fun camera.

Review.author: G. Lin
Review.title: Great Product, but the next version will be much better.

Text.text: It was a blast learning how to photograph again.
When you first start, you think like a photographer.
But after a while, you think like a bird or insect.
How do I show the best experience around me rather than in front of me.
You start to get close to things and inside things.
Great 360 camera, I used it mostly on my vacations, easy to carry.
Fits good

Review.author: Cameron C. Platt
Review.title: The resolution leaves a bit to be desired, but ...

Text.text: The resolution leaves a bit to be desired, but for a sub-$400 innovative product, it's workable.
I would be interested to see the next (or next next) generation of this product.
Great camera unfortunately I couldn't make use of it like I had hoped.
Super simple, easy to use, and turns out good quality images.
Most people don't know what it is and I have a lot of fun showing off the phone app at social gatherings.
I've taken my Ricoh around the world and it's never let me down.
Sweet 360 spherical camera.
I have seen a friend with one of these and how versatile this camera is for my line of work.
Highly recommend it.

Review.author: Pauline
Review.title: Best VR camera for the price point and easy to use!

Text.text: I am a virtual reality software engineer who has had experience with the HTC Vive, Oculus Rift DK2 and new consumer version, and various other devices.
I recently bought this camera and it worked fine for one week...
Suddenly it stopped working, does not turn on looking dead, no light at all...
Contacted support but no answer so far...

Review.author: Colin H.
Review.title: Improved from the first version, still has a bit of a ways to go.

Text.text: It does what it says it does.
The pictures are pretty decent, as long as you have even exposure.
Doesn't do terribly well when one side is lit much brighter than the other.
Video quality is just ok too, despite the massive size.
And it takes FOREVER to process.
If you take a 10 minute video, be prepared to not be able to use the camera for 10 - 15 minutes afterwards while it processes.
Amazing photo quality, nice app.
Sadly their app is missing a cardboard-compatible VR viewer, but there are other apps in the play store that will let you view the photos and videos via cardboard.

Review.author: Cody P Renshaw
Review.title: Re-live my New Zealand vacation! Great camera, great seller!

Text.text: This camera is incredible.
The video quality is not super high resolution, but the photos are very clear.
This camera allows me to relive my New Zealand vacation: [...]

Review.author: Sara Spaedy
Review.title: The concept is absolutely delightful and the design and functionality of the Theta S makes it quick and easy. Physically

Text.text: The Ricoh Theta S is a hand-held, point-and-shoot 360-degree camera.
The S is the third incarnation of the Theta cameras (Theta360 was first, followed by Theta m15).
The concept is absolutely delightful and the design and functionality of the Theta S makes it quick and easy.
Great consumer grade 360 camera
Absolutely loving it so far!

Review.author: Michael C. Shanton
Review.title: Absolutely amazing. And the firmware update that added the timer ...

Text.text: Absolutely amazing.
And the firmware update that added the timer made it great.
Looking forward to Ricoh releasing another one in 4K.
Then it will be perfect.
Because that is the only downside.
The video quality.
Photo quality is GREAT but not PERFECT...
I was amazed at the software's horrible performance.

The iPhone and Android versions won't connect because it always says the password is wrong and the Windows 10 software won't even install (yeah, I installed Adobe Air even if the manual never mentions it).
LOVE THIS CAMERA.
For only $300 you can do something that no one else can do with their cameras - a big feat in this day and age.
It's worth the investment!

Review.author: Amazon Customer
Review.title: First didn't connect to PC, now does not even turn on!!

Text.text: First when I got the device, I tried to connect it to my PC using the app on the website, but it didn't register, the app would get stuck on the registration page forever.

Review.author: Brent Bowers
Review.title: Hard to Beat for the Money

Text.text: For the price, the functionality offered in this little camera is hard to beat.
I couldn't see myself going higher dollar for such a specialized type of tool, so I'm fine with trading off the finer detail at a distance.
It works precisely as described and the sharing via the included app both on the Theta site and via social media worked exactly as expected.
A fun camera for a very reasonable price.
Connectivity and function with my iPhone 7S have proved excellent!

Review.author: Tony
Review.title: The description is really cool and in theory it's cool but reality it isn't ...

Text.text: I think 0 stars is more in order.
I purchased this item with high expectations.
The description is really cool and in theory it's cool but reality it isn't that great.
Your phone's panoramic capabilities are 90% of what this camera does.
Can't wait for the next years model for much needed improvement.

Review.author: MerlynNY
Review.title: If you like spending $300 for a product that doesn't work...

Text.text: If you are considering buying this Ricoh Theta S 360 camera please heed my words first.

Review.author: Kirk Rogers
Review.title: Unreliable app; Limited use without app

Text.text: Instead of Bluetooth, this device uses wifi to connect to your mobile phone.
The app is essential in order to take photos and videos without yourself in the shot.
However, the wifi connection is extremely unreliable.
I could only get it to connect about 1 out of every 10 tries, from multiple devices.
Because it's wifi, it also requires you disconnect from any existing wifi to work.
Works great with Google StreetView app on iphone.
Transfer to fone with adhoc wifi connection, then Upload to Google Maps or FB for 360 shots.
Love it!
Many complain about the resolution.
It is not the greatest, but looks fantastic!
Zoom in close and image becomes blurry, but that's not the point in my opinion.
It is to see the 360 degree image.
If you want closeups, use a DSLR.
I bought the Theta-S to take bracketed HDRI photos for Visual Effects work.
It's very fast and compact in comparison to the traditional DSLR nodal head style.
It has done a fantastic job on every scenario except direct sunlight.
I had to fashion a 2-stop ND filter in order to capture in the sun beside the shutter isn't fast enough to compensate for the massive brightness of the sun.
I'm so glad that Ricoh made an API for this camera, since it lets 3 party developers create amazing apps for it.
The video resolution isn't great, but that's not why I bought this camera.
Love it.
Only down fall have to go online to view and copy your 3-D images
Not built for streaming.
This product is fantastic for stills, but horrendous for live streaming to YouTube.
If you connect via USB, the best you will get is 720s at 15fps.
That is pretty close to 240p when you consider the 720s is for a 360 degree video, not for a given shot.
Because the frame rate is so slow and the resolution is so poor, overall the video looks horrendous.

Review.author: CKoenig
Review.title: Great 360 camera, not the highest of video quality

Text.text: Great 360 camera, great app for the iPhone.
The only con; the video/photo is not very high resolution.

Review.author: John Z
Review.title: App doesn't work, wifi connection barely works, renders camera useless.

Text.text: ios app doesn't connect, (there are several reviews on app store stating same, it seems to have been an issue for a long time) makes the whole $300 camera pretty useless.
So awesome.
Takes pictures to a hole other level.
Great for big groups just have everyone circle around so you don't have to make sure you're all crammed in a little frame
Love it.
Amazing camera.
But handle with care!!

Review.author: Misko031
Review.title: Great idea but here its where I got frustrated

Text.text: Great idea but here its where I got frustrated:
It arrived pretty late.
Was planning to capture NYC for christmas but ended up taking snaps in boston new year snaps.
Still learning about 360 spherical photos.

Review.author: Rob Miller
Review.title: Absolutely amazing photos. I love capturing photos & video on ...

Text.text: Absolutely amazing photos.
I love capturing photos & video on this camera.
I still use other cameras to get higher pixel photos, but everyone should have one of these.

Review.author: Brick Wall
Review.title: So far it's a pretty good investment

Text.text: So far it's a pretty good investment.
There are a few things that could be better.
Would like to see an LCD screen so I don't have to try and remember all the codes for the blinking lights.
Or trying to see the color differences as I'm color blind.

Review.author: Aaron
Review.title: Amazing! Watch my youtube link for an example of video quality and the viewing experience.

Text.text: This is the future and it's pretty awesome.
I took this 360 camera out to eat at a hibachi restaurant.
You can see the full range of the camera!
Any group activity turns out great just surround the action around the camera.
Watch my youtube video of the hibachi restaurant to see what the 360 camera quality is like.
easy to use, takes good pictures.
I use w app for iPhone, only concern is file size is small, may lose resolution w printing...haven't tested it yet.

Review.author: D. Smith
Review.title: I want to love this camera... but:

Text.text: Like many others here I was looking to get into a spherical camera/video setup with minimal cost and a user freindly device and workflow.
The good: Photos are pretty decent and easy to use right out of the camera.
There are issues with chromatic abberation and other artifacts that are understandable given the lens system, but to the average person they will have no problems with the pictures.
The video, on the other hand, is not quite high-resolution enough for anything more than gimmicky fun.
My biggest complaints are outside of the camera though...
If you are expecting a pro level high resolution VR camera, then this camera is not for you.
It takes several cameras and hours of editing to produce high definition 360 content.
There is a 360 gopro rig that can produce much higher quality video for over 10 times the cost of this camera.
What I feel this camera is best for is to make 360 videos more accessible to the average consumer.
I'm sure the overall quality of videos will get better with each generation.
We will probably see a 1440p video resolution for the next theta s generation.

Review.author: Seth Ward
Review.title: Great still camera, overstated video quality and frustrating software.

Text.text: The camera itself is a lot of fun.
Photo quality is great, and you can create some really fun shots even from a quick set-up.
I appreciate the ease of use, especially after using Gigapan Epic, which has tremendous output at the cost of much time and effort.
I love this camera.
The photos and videos are awesome.
You need to be close to the subject for any kind of detail.
The camera is easy to use.
There are only 4 buttons on it.
It can also be connected to your smart phone to use as a shutter release or to make changes to the settings.
I bought this to make some 360 videos for my motovlog.
I wanted to give my friends a feel of what its like riding the motorcycle.
I mount the camera on a selfie stick connected to the sissybar on the back on my bike.
I get a really cool 3rd person view of the bike and the surrounding environment.
My main complaint with the camera is the recording time.
25 minutes sounds like a lot of time but if I am riding all day I can fill it up.
The battery lasts longer then the recording time.
This is good when the camera is mounted behind me.
I can start and stop the camera with my phone but can't power it on/off.
I just got a battery pack so I can plug in and charge the camera and leave it on for the duration of the ride.

Review.author: Chaz Curtis
Review.title: Good try, Ricoh, but the videos are not HD

Text.text: The answer to everyone's question of which VR camera is best for consumers is, there is none.
The best HD video camera for the average consumer is priced too high for the average consumer.
You have to move into the realm of professional grade setups, like the Nokia OZO ($60,000) or the Freedom360 GoPro Mount with six GoPros ($2,500).

Review.author: ReviewsByDeal
Review.title: Nearly perfect. An awesome value and highly recommended product.

Text.text: If you are expecting pro quality video, you are looking at the wrong camera, but those are an order of magnitude more expensive.
For the market it serves, this camera is nearly flawless.
I will not go into hyper-technical detail with this review, but simply explain why as a casual user this is one fantastic value.
This is one cool device...even better now that they have added HDR capture and processing via the latest firmware update....I only wish the edge focus was as clear as the center.
Chromatic aberration is visible in much of the high contrast areas especially at the edges...
I love the fact that the camera makes itself disappear when you set it on a surface.
You won't see it when you pan around the image.
If you set in on a tripod though, you will see the tripod but not the camera itself.

Review.author: B. Jordan
Review.title: Maybe the best in its class, but unfortunately: still an expensive toy.

Text.text: I've been waiting for the Theta S for a while now.
I ordered it on Amazon as soon as it was available, and sadly had a bit of a customer support nightmare when Amazon didn't have enough of them to ship out.
I finally acquired the Theta S elsewhere, and I should note that experiences like this with Amazon are very, very uncommon.

It's so uncommon that I'm inclined to blame the manufacturer, but I have no evidence to hold anything against them, so let's just say I finally have the product after a bunch of unnecessary hardship and leave it at that.
Easy to use.
Great for trying out 360 imaging/video for the first time.
The smartphone apps are good, but wish the computer apps were better.
Don't get your hopes up - and video for 360 has to be 4k to be worth a darn.
I return mine thought I could use it on weddings but video not even close to 1080p ..
Great job!

Review.author: Gallery90
Review.title: Split Decision: Stills -- 4 Stars / Videos -- 1 Star

Text.text: I upgraded from the earlier Theta M15 and find the still photo functionality and results much improved.
I had a problem with my first Theta S -- I had an area in one lens's view that was always blurry.
Ricoh had to replace the entire camera.

Review.author: j031
Review.title: Awesome little camera that takes decent 360 pictures and videos.

Text.text: This product takes 360 degree photos or videos with one click of the button on the device.
You can also pair with wifi to your mobile phone and control it through the phone.
When attached to the phone it allows you to preview what the shot will look like.
You also have complete control of the camera settings so you can adjust for lighting, etc.
The pictures are decent quality and can be uploaded to Facebook and then displayed as in a 360 mode that Facebook supports natively now.
I just got my Theta yesterday, so this review may change over time.
It was used, but still came in the box and was only missing the USB cable and instruction guide.
I've heard the guide is pretty short and you're better off reading a more comprehensive guide online.
The down side to this is that if you're using a cell phone to operate the camera, you must connect via WiFi which kills your ability to connect to the internet via WiFi.
Annoying, but not a serious problem.
I don't like this camera at all.
Not very user friendly.
The online gallery to view 360 photos is terrible.
I am not happy with my purchase at all.
I absolutely regret buying this camera.

Review.author: Matt H.
Review.title: Won't back up their Cheap plastic camera mount.

Text.text: The camera is great, however the tripod mount is plastic and the first time I used it, it broke.
No problem I say.
I purchased a 4 year warranty.
Well it turns out that warranty is only good for the last 3 years after the 1 year Ricoh warranty runs out.
No problem I say.
I'll get ahold of the Ricoh warranty personnel.
Turns out they don't cover their cheap plastic tripod mount.
Very disappointed.
This is my first ever 1 star review.
I hate to give it for this because it is really nice, but I cannot use it as needed so......
Love it

Review.author: Amazon Customer
Review.title: That's so awesome camera with the 360 degree no matter in picture ...

Text.text: That's so awesome camera with the 360 degree no matter in picture or video!
Still not much people know and have it too, friends mine they were so curious & surprised with the effect!
I can't wait bring it with me go for travel and take some stunning 360 degree pictures & videos to share with my family members & friends.
These product it was recommended by my frien, so now I highly recommend to everyone these camera is the best choice 👍

Review.author: Stone
Review.title: I'm alright with it, but would recommend holding out for the next version perhaps...

Text.text: I was about to give it 3 stars, but for what it is and the cost, it's pretty nifty and cool.
I'm not a big fan of the overall video quality, but inside of a few feet away from the camera, it's not bad.
Picks up audio pretty decently, so no real complaints ... just not the quality I would like to see.
I admit, I'm pretty spoiled with my GoPro and the video quality, but you will not get that here and that is to be expected right from the get-go.
Having said that, all of the functionalities are nice and convenient.

Getting the video off and into a format that YouTube recognizes for a cool 360 degree experience is a bit tedious, but then again that's to be expected as these cameras and the technology is still fairly new-ish.
All I've used it for is for videos though, haven't taken any still pictures with it.
I've only used it indoors with adequate lighting in a medium sized room.

I'm sure there is a 3rd party software application that allows you to edit the video and add captions, cutting and other various forms of editing, but I've only used the application that Ricoh supplies on their website.
It's free, not too bad, but very limiting and basic.

Review.author: Amazon Customer
Review.title: Close to Perfect for an Entry Level 360 Camera

Text.text: Works great, especially for those who are just getting into 360 media and not wanting to spends a few thousand dollars.
Occasionally drops signal and doesn't record/take the photo when expected.
But hopefully it'll be fixed through firmware updates.
Perfect, fun and easy to use
Not yet started my real work.
As of now it looks good

Review.author: Jennifer Belinato
Review.title: The product is amazing! Makes pictures perfect 360

Text.text: The product is amazing!
Makes pictures perfect 360!
Problem that he stopped working in two months!
And Amazon does not return the product!
I lost 350 Dollars
The Ricoh Theta S application that you must run any video footage through in order to share it is ABSOLUTE garbage.
The camera takes a decent looking image and provided you never plan on exporting that image off of your phone you can enjoy the footage just fine.

Review.author: CraigG Knoxville
Review.title: The Best 360 Camera I've Found For The Money!

Text.text: I've been involved in developing software and hardware products for shooting 360x360 panos for almost 18 years and this product is absolutely amazing for the price.
The HDR capability for stills does a pretty decent job on indoor shots of rooms with brightly lit windows as well as saving the sky on bright sunny days!
The low light image quality is MUCH better than the Ricoh Theta M15.
The images I've included with this review were shot with normal room light on a bright sunny day.
Sharing pictures on this is a little hard because it's such a a new Technology.
But other then that it's pretty amazing for what you are paying, totally worth the 300 bucks.
I bought the camera to catalog trips that I take and events that I attend.
On the whole, I'm satisfied with the Ricoh Theta S in regard to its simplicity of use when taking pictures.
Sadly, low light pictures are a bit grainy.
I took the camera to a car show this past weekend and the darker fabric interiors turned out too grainy to enjoy.

Review.author: RJ
Review.title: I've taken some still photos and some video so far and have had a lot of fun using the Theta S

Text.text: Full Disclosure- I work for Ricoh but in a completely different division.
The minute I saw this camera, I knew I wanted one.
It's not meant for everyday use and general photography but it has it's place.
I've taken some still photos and some video so far and have had a lot of fun using the Theta S .
Overall it is very well made and very easy to use.
I paired it with my Galaxy S5 without any problems and I love the fact that I can control the camera with phone.
All in all a great little device.
This is an awesome camera.
It is like being there

Review.author: D. Burnham
Review.title: Best camera in this price range

Text.text: As an amateur photographer, I love the Theta S!
It has brought a totally different perspective to my photos and our recent vacation photos really come to life when combined with a google cardboard device.

Review.author: jimbaran
Review.title: I know the technology is not there yet but it'll be great to have a truly 1080p video while it doesn't ...

Text.text: I posted 3 stars because of the quality of the photo/video.
I know the technology is not there yet but it'll be great to have a truly 1080p video while it doesn't look like a 360p.
Great bit of kit!
Very good build quality and you can't beat the ease of use.
The pictures are awesome.
As long as all you want are pictures, it is great.
But, the video is HORRIBLE.
The video is 1920x1080, but that is for the whole 360 degrees which means the small portion of the video actually on your screen is a small amount of the 1920x1080 and is very very poor quality.
Waste of money.
Instructions suck.
Support nonexistent.... Be forewarned BUY AT YUOR OWN RISK!

You have to use the Ricoh cloud (their server) and Facebook to utilize the ability to mouse around the image when using a computer, which makes it, well, useless for anything... except for posting on Facebook.
Save your money buy another more user friendly 360.
I'm stuck with a very expensive paperweight.... DO NOT BUY!

Review.author: Caitlin Elizabeth
Review.title: Still photos are amazing but are really only viewable in the ricoh software ...

Text.text: Still photos are amazing but are really only viewable in the ricoh software and app.

I do like the camera, but when you want to post a pic to Facebook (FB), you need to run it through the phone or desktop app first, otherwise the photo will be 'flat', i.e., a 360 photo flattened out, not what you want.
When it runs thought the Ricoh software, then when you post it (or view it) you can scroll around 360 degrees, very nice.
Videos posted to FB look grainy and bleached out because FB reduces resolution, but still, it's fun.

But my camera (got it yesterday) has some problem so when I run it through the software to see the photo in VR using a headset and my phone, the pic moves up and down but not left and right (to go around 360).
I spoke with the guy at Ricoh for a long time and he says he will have to 'escalate' the issue, which means ask someone in Japan for help.
Meanwhile, I'll just send this back to Amazon and get a replacement......OK, I got the replacement, but there is no change.
The 'VR View' (twin lens) just does not work.
I will wait for Ricoh to call me back, as they promised to do.

But, it looks fair when viewed on my computer using their app.
An uploaded video to YouTube looks worse though, and that may be because of the compression YouTube applies to the video.
I'd rate the video as 'poor' once it's one YouTube, even though its 'fair' on my computer.
Very good product, photo quality is good with me, but software in mobile some time brocken.
I love taking 360 photos or photospheres in Google's world.
Until now, I've only used a phone and Google's applications to produce them.
It is really nice to see a photo as if you are standing on the spot it was shot and see all around you.
So, when I saw this camera, its reviews, and some photos shot with it, I was excited to try it out.
I wasn't interested in the video recording feature of this camera, only the photo shooting mode, and that is what I'm reviewing.

Review.author: Jeff Jasper
Review.title: It is easy enough for them to use and the still images ...

Text.text: I do professional VR using professional camera rigs.
That means anywhere from 6 to 20+ cameras to shoot spherical video.
I got the Theta for shooting with the kids.
It is easy enough for them to use and the still images are fantastic.
I also use it with a bracketing app on my phone to shoot HDRs for CG lighting and rendering.
Video is too low resolution so it is very very soft when watching on Cardboard or a Rift.
But it is my far the easiest 360 image/video solution out there at least until the Nikon starts shipping.
If Ricoh could get the video up to 4Kx2K 30fps then it would be a true winner.

I am giving 1 star due to the poor quality PLASTIC camera tripod mounting threads.
Within just 3 months of use, the threads cracked.
This may not be a big deal to some, but I wouldn't trust the threads to hold secure for anything but taking shots at a stand-still.
I called RICOH regarding the plastic thread issue and rep said RICOH is aware of complaints filed, but still have no plans to changing to metal camera tripod mounts.
for 349.00 price, you would think metal threads would have been used from the get go.
Stripped or cracked threads are not covered under warranty.

Review.author: J. Paulsonn
Review.title: Frequent firmware updates keep adding new features!

Text.text: I was a little hesitant to buy this camera, thinking it would be such a special-use device that I would rarely use it.
After about 4 months of use, I can say that I love it!
It's very easy to use and the results are terrific.
Facebook now accepts 360° photos which people love (but only 1 photo can be posted at a time--no albums of 360's).
What's particularly nice is that Ricoh offers firmware updates every couple of months that keep adding new features such as time-delay exposure that were not in the camera as delivered.
Updates are easily installed by attaching the camera to your Mac or PC with a USB cable.
Just make sure the camera is fully charged when you update it.

Generally speaking, I find interior shots more interesting in 360° than outdoor, partly because there can be more in the photo than bare sky and ground, but every user will have individual preferences on that score.
I strongly recommend the use of a monopod like the Smatree SmaPole Q3 available here on Amazon.
It’s great.

Wonderful quality.
I’m an engineer and the Ricoh Theta S works great for site visits when I travel for work.
I also purchased a 6” tripod that works great with it.

Using the app on my phone (both android and iPhone), I’m able to walk around the corner and not appear in any of the photos since the camera sends a live image (via the camera’s own WiFi network) to my phone.
The camera has a lot of customizable settings including ISO and shutter speed.
It’s not the best at high contrast (say a black ceiling and a glaring light in it) but I’ve had very good results with a tripod when shooting in low light.
I purchased two more for my team after being impressed with the first one we bought.
It’s now a must have in our travel tool kit.
The camera has a shutter button so you don’t need the app to use it.
The camera’s biggest con is it doesn’t have a screen but it’s not a huge issue because the app is pretty decent.
You do have to download Richo’s software to fully take advantage of the 360 degree images but it’s free.
I wish they offered software for their videos (they might but I haven’t found it).
Very user friendly, compatible with Android and iPhone, totally recommend

Review.author: Inspired Imaging
Review.title: Great little camera and LOTS of fun!

Here's a couple things I didn't see answers to in other reviews...

Review.author: Therese
Review.title: There's room for improvement, but I do love what it can do

Text.text: I got this camera only 3 weeks ago, and it received some heavy beating from my use.
First, I used it in an evening concert.
Video is decent, audio not that great.
Since it's spherical, it's a bit difficult to remove the glare from spotlights.
Photos at night are pretty good.
Then I took it to the job site and attached it to a trolley of a rollercoaster zipline (I need to video the tracks in action) - and it was great!
Not only does it capture everything (front, side, back) but I can also zoom it, giving me enough information to review our work.
Finding a mount for it was a bit of a challenge.
I used the more readily available and cheaper gopro mounting accessories, and an adaptor for the mount.
Even with the g-force of the drops of the ride, the camera held steady.
I also attached it on a bike helmet.
It's also interesting.
Then I took it to a trip to the islands.
I was a bit paranoid, afraid to get it wet with the boat ride.
I wish it has waterproof cover, it would be great to take it diving.
For field assessment work, it's very useful.
I used spend a lot of time taking panoramic shots, but then as a planner, it's difficult to get a sense of proportion with it.
With this, it's much easier and faster for documentation.
If I need details or specific area of the photo, I just crop it, and there's minimum distortion.
Parts of the image are a bit blurry the further you get from center lens.
Image quality is still very good and it being Maps compatible means you can upload straight to Street View with very little effort.
Fun product, easy to use.
Software works well (especially the stitching, which is seamless).
Nice camera but be careful of defective items.
Great camera at a great price!
Delivery was fast the camera was well packaged.

Review.author: dotcommer
Review.title: A decent improvement over the original, continues to lack in video quality.

Text.text: While they drastically improved the stills that you can take with this camera over the original Theta and the m15, the video is still absolutely terrible.
I work in VR professionally, and I can not say that this is even remotely a good camera for the average consumer to take 360 video with.
It can take stills up to 5K which is awesome, but the video is recorded as two hemispheres side-by-side in a 1920x1080 frame.
This means that when you use their software to stitch the two halves together, you'll get a less than 1080p image, blown up to 1920x960.
The bare-minimum for a decent experience in VR and on youtube is 2K.
This is nowhere near it, and you'll see the lack of quality when it stitches it, and you upload it to youtube.

Review.author: Brian Lee
Review.title: Great Camera, videos look good as well.

Text.text: The Theta S is like a gem waiting for polish.
Its 360 degree dual sensor design almost gives it a seamless 360 FOV but you can slightly tell where the two images blend.
In photo mode, it's not bad but don't expect sharpness and high dynamic range you'll have to get into the smartphone app to adjust manual controls on the camera.
It tries to preserve highlights of the image all around at the expense of darkened subjects.
The manual controls really help here.
The video quality isn't so bad either.
Don't make the same mistake I did watching Theta S VR videos on 'Auto' quality on YouTube.
Crank it up to the highest quality.
All I need to figure out now is how to get rid of the annoying 'chirp' sound when I take pictures.

Review.author: Martin Brossman

Text.text: I love the design, idea and quality of it and am very disappointed in the support of this product so far.
I have asked that the massively improve the quality of the education on how to use this product.
If you feel tech savvy it would say go for it but if you are not be pre-warned.
I had challenges figuring out how to configure it with my app and still at this I have not figure out how to get videos posted on YouTube yet.
I think is needs to be mounted on a Monopod with small feed for the best image without your hand strangely in the picture and controlled by your smart phone.
Also I would also use a mini tripod for table use.
They need more demo videos on how to set it up and use it.
I think this is key to this products success.
I home they will listen and improve the support and help.
I really love this product and what it to succeed.
It is the most affordable entry into the 360 photo world.
You can add 360 images directly to the Google Street view app but for some reason not share directly to Google Plus?
I love the idea of 360 videos and hope to figure it out soon.

The resolution was too low, and the dynamic range was not on par with point and shoot digital cameras (or even my phone camera).
When the Theta S was announced, I preordered it on the strength of the m15 hoping for improvements in resolution.
I love this camera!
I got it because I'm always taking pictures and videos of my kids and I'm never in it.
It works really well and the quality of the images are great.

There were 80+ pictures on it, some food, marks, the wifi password had been changed, and there were minor LENS SCRATCHES.
This was not right Amazon!!!
If I had paid a low, refurbished, price -- it might have been ok, small lens scratches don't actually make much image difference.
But this was wrong and I've returned it for exchange.
I left pictures on it so if you get Theta S XS00236813, images from 10/29/2016 are me :-).

Review.author: Jeff Holliday
Review.title: Lenses are easily damaged and can not be repaired.

Text.text: So easily damaged and no way to repair.
My Canon t2i lenses have been all over North America from the sands of the Florida Keys to the rocky bottom of the Grand Canyon.
It has virtually zero lens damage.
One trip with the Theta S and both lenses have damage that shows up on every photo taken.
I sent an email to Ricoh customer service on repair options and found out that this camera is unrepairable.
The only other Theta S owner I have met reported the same damage has occurred to their lenses.
If you look closely at the lens of these cameras posted for sale on Ebay you will can see what appears to be a horizontal smudge across the lens.
Depending on the degree of damage this can result in a blurring effect that reality shows like COPS would be proud to have as it can totally obscure a person's face.
Very easy to use.

Uploading to social media a cinch.

Review.author: T. Paris
Review.title: Not what I expected, but more fun.

Text.text: This is a very fun toy.
I am not usually an early adopter of new technology, but I bought this on a whim because I was going on a sailing trip and I thought it would be able to take some nice scenery shots.
It turns out that it can't take very good resolution pictures of far away scenery.
That is just the nature of this type of system; the pixels are spread over such a wide angle (360 degrees in 3 dimensions) that subjects just a few hundred feet away start to look blurry.
It is great for taking a group photo without everyone having to move to one location.
You just set it in the middle of the group and click.

Everyone looks natural, except maybe the photographer, because you must either press the button on the camera (so your arm dominates that part of the picture) or you are looking at your phone to control the camera when the picture is taken.
An option in the software to delay the picture a second or five would be nice (maybe an update).
Taking movies with it is a whole different experience.
I set it in the middle of the sailboat cockpit as we were sailing and the resulting video captures the fun and excitement of the crew as well as flapping sails, ocean waves and nearby islands.
Being able to record sound would make this indispensable (again, perhaps a software update could use the phone's microphone to record the sound and add it to the video file).
I am looking forward to using it while walking on a crowded street, on the beach, or in a small concert venue.

Not the camera's fault it actually does a great job in my opinion.
Linked below is a sample photo from the top of the Empire state Building.
I took a lot of 360 selfies on vacation.

Review.author: Amazon Customer
Review.title: The price is great for what is does and I am overly critical​ ...

Text.text: The price is great for what is does and I am overly critical​ as I work with a Pro VR company.
I am though very pleased with this as a low cost alternative FWIW
The 360 photos look amazing.
I love how I can post to Facebook and YouTube to share the experience with family and friends.
360 video works too but I mostly just take stills because the video resolution is just alright with video.
It's a great consumer 360 camera for the price.
Links to your smartphone for capturing and storing images.
Within the app it has a VR mode or single screen to view the 360.
There's also a normal mode that allows for custom viewing, zoom out to create some fisheye lens mode or zoom in to view details.
This camera also mounts on normal tripods.
Loved it!
Fantastic easy to use product.
Photos are amazing but the video quality and render time is the biggest drawback.
I would also love it if there were a faster way to connect to a remote (rather than via the app) to take photos from a distance... or a timer would have been great.

Review.author: Robert Fuge
Review.title: Good for pics not for videos

Text.text: I really wanted to love this camera, I loved the concept.
It does a good job taking pictures but the video quality is very lacking.
I was planning on using this for real estate walk-through videos.
But it just seems the resolution is too low and you can clearly see where the 2 lenses are merged because the colors don't match.
Here is a sample video I took for one of my clients.
This is a great product!
Very fast delivery the camera is realy great thanks you
the camera will be ok the trouble I had with the seller was not worth it buy it from a different camera company

Review.author: Amazon Customer
Review.title: Ricoh Theta S is a great unit

Text.text: Unfortunately I had lost my Ricoh Theta m15.
I therefore ordered the Theta S. Better quality, easier to use.

Review.author: Rick Cipes
Review.title: Not for the Techno Challenged or Impatient

Text.text: Unless you are extremely efficient AND patient with technology ABSOLUTELY DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME on this, it's way too much of a hassle getting up ad running and will take you a long and arduous time.
The directions it comes with are practically nothing and the online site isn't much better at explaining things.
Fun camera when it works.
This one died 32 days after purchase.
They don't adjust for shipping time.
Be very careful.
The product is in good shape and it works as it should.
It comes with a box, instructions and thin case and USB 2.0 cable.
I'd recommend getting a micro hdmi for the camera as well.
Overall, good quality of product and on-time delivery.
Thank you.
I wish it had a removeable memory card and battery.
On trips it would be nice to not fill up the internal memory space and to have back up batteries.
I wish you could see the video on the app when recording.
Seeing the pics on the app is really cool!
It's a fun light weight camera.
Good job

Review.author: R. Kester
Review.title: Wow, What a Fail Right Out of the Box!

Text.text: I don't even know where to begin.
The camera looks great, it has lots of cool flashy lights.
But that is where the cool part ends and the awful part begins.
First problem, it will not connect to any of my devices wifi.
I found lots and lots of posts about users with this problem.
I wasted 2 hours trying over and over.
All fails every time.
And trying to connect to a Mac, also fails over and over.
Second, the app for iOS is listed as discontinued, not a good sign for a product purchased new.
I would highly recommend you avoid this camera despite the cute looks and easy to use 'operation' because you are most likely going to want to toss it against a wall.
Thank goodness I tested it before giving it as a gift.
I'd feel like a proper jerk for gifting this hunk of garbage to anyone.
Shame on Ricoh for making this junk and shame on them for making it literally fail right out of the box.
It is going back and I will find another brand product that does the same, for the same money, that actually works.

Review.author: ASP
Review.title: Recorded videos look great in the app, but disappointing when sharing to YouTube or Facebook.

Text.text: My company purchased this camera from B&H to test out its 360 capabilities on android phones.
It is a well-built camera, with a basic app that runs smoothly, but disappointing video quality when sharing on YouTube and Facebook.
Video in the Theta app looks great though.
what a cool camera
It's like magic!
360 view, pictures and video
We love our Theta S, best value for the $ in the 360 game right now
Takes great pictures but due to the camera having bubbled lenses that stick out BOTH sides be sure to protect the camera.
The soft included case is NOT enough to do this alone.

Review.title: Sharp Photos, Not So Sharp Video

Text.text: Pictures are sharp, video not so much.
Also I wish the photo settings were more intuitive and the interface could be better.

Review.author: Inventomatic
Review.title: it was fun for a day or two but I don't see ...

Text.text: I bought this for our business.
We are an engineering firm and we take this with us to job site visits.
It's really helped out when we are back in the office discussing the job.
We can look anywhere we want while watching the video.
As for home/family use, it was fun for a day or two but I don't see using it for family events very much.
